Reviews.Title: “Just, what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: VolkerS2
Reviews.Content: Very close to Miami International Airport, but quiet neighborhood anyway. I had a small King-Suite for a very reasonable price. Enough space, a nice high kitchen table, two chairs and a sofa, everything you need in a kitchenette, clean and comfortable. Okay, there is no breakfast and not a daily maid-service, but you know this, when you book the location. Front-desk was friendly and helpful, Publix, Burger King, MacDonalds and restaurants are very close. I actually missed nothing. If you are not in the need to be pampered more than at home - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ak313
Reviews.Content: Narrowed my search for an affordable/clean/safe hotel near Miami Beach down to this one. I decided to go with a national brand because of standards/reputation they have to be concerned with rather than taking a shot-in-the-dark at an independent. Turned out to be a good decision. The property and landscaping were immaculate from the exterior. Rooms were clean - bathroom and kitchenette were satisfactory. A good deal - and about 15 min to Miami Beach. For what it is - 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Luke warm”
Reviews.Author: LJL8
Reviews.Content: If you like a HOT shower, do NOT stay at this hotel. After a few days of tepid water I called the front desk to complain. The person replied that they had never heard of anyone having that problem before. The technician was coming in that afternoon and she would talk to him about it. The next evening I got back to my room, tested the water and called the front desk again. I said the water was the same, what was going to be done about it. I told this new person that I had wanted a bath and had to boil pans of water on the hot plates in my room to get the hot water I needed. I was told again that the technician would have a look. The third day I called again when the water temp still hadn't changed. This time the person on the desk asked if I would like to try a different room. I got the key to another room, checked the temp, it never got hot, went back to reception to be told that that was the temperature the boilers were kept at. I then said I would be checking out. I found the Extended Stay just around the corner and am very happy. For only a few more dollars a day I am having lots of HOT SHOWERS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: scorprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed just over night as it was close to the airport, but would stay again! I beleive that all the rooms have a kitchenette in them and if you needed to stay longer, it would be a nice place to stay. It has a gate that you need to use the key to get into the complex, rooms were nice and clean, has laundry facilities (that we saw) and front desk person was very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Rude night front desk agent who worked on 12/23/2011 is the reason I will no longer stay at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jackie g
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay here until an employee by the name of Maria who works the night shift a new hire who started no more than a week ago ruined my stay. She worked the night shift on 12/23/2011- Not to be confused with one of the managers who's name is also Maria. Maria the manager is great. But Maria the front desk night agent is horrible horrible horrible . I believe her name is not really even Maria they just do not have a name tag for her yet and she uses someone else's name tag. Maria the front desk night agent is extremely rude, On 12/22/2012 she called me at my room in a harassing tone when my payment for the room was one day late , She was plainly rude and arrogant in her tone, It almost sounded like she was the police threatening me to pay or get out. I have been staying at this hotel for over 3 months and have spent well over $6,000 dollars??? I would believe I could have been extended some courtesy. She also treated my husband rudely when he wen't to pay at the front desk . She behaved as if she was the owner of this hotel and we owed her something? She does not know how to treat guest with courtesy nor respect, and deserves to be fired. This night attendant is the reason we are leaving this hotel . We were going to stay until Jan 15 2011 so it's there lost. , People like us who could have been great guest and who would of retuned time after time, will simply go somewhere else now where all the money we have spent here about $6,000 dollars will be more appreciated . We will never stay here ever again. Better personal needs to be hired!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: RFDisturbance
Reviews.Content: Well, I really don't like writing bad reviews, but unfortunately I feel the need to warn other travelers in regards to establishments like this one. We arrived late in the evening, and was greeted by friendly hotel front desk staff. We were given our room number and key. When we got to the room, my wife went in to take care of personal business, while I got what we needed for the one night from our rental. When I got back to the room, my wife informed me that the toilet would not flush. So we contacted the front desk, and were told that maintenance would not be around till the morning. One good point to this experience was the front desk offered us another room on the other side of the hotel overlooking the lagoon. No problem, not yet at least. We moved and found the new room to be filthy and disgusting. Kitchen was rusted, and falling apart. Front door door handle was falling off, and would not lock properly. Just a little shove, and the door popped open even though it was locked. Bed was slightly damp, I don't even want to know why. Outside the room was two vehicles running, tinted windows, smoke coming our of their windows, as they were talking and passing something back and forth. It appeared to me that this parking lot was a hot spot to do business since this happened several times throughout the night. I know this because I stayed awake the entire night keeping watch since I did not trust the area or the door. My wife slept on the chair with her feet propped up on the footrest. Luggage stayed in the vehicle due to fear of bugs, which happened to reside in the shower. We contacted the front desk, but apparently this was the only other room. We were told we should stay there since it was only for one night anyway. Apparently there was also no regard for hotel guest safety or security since noone came around to check the deals being made in the parking lot, and since maintenance was gone for the night, no chance of getting the door fixed. Needless to say, I got no sleep, my wife had back pains in the morning, it was an overall horrible experience, we will not be staying in a hotel like this or chain of this kind again, but hey, at least the toilet worked in the second room. Right? Be warned! Low prices, convenient location (close to the airport), and beautiful view of the lagoon does not equal a superior experience. Pay the extra money and stay somewhere, anywhere, else.

Reviews.Title: “Homestead Miami Blue Lagoon - Awesome treatment”
Reviews.Author: mukesh68
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay , its a nice commercial area on the southern border of the Miami Airport. The neighborhood was very quiet,The front desk staff was very pleasant. Very recomended hotel, very helpfull staff, clean and nice rooms!! the special thing I also like is local calls are free of charge & no parking fees for your car.I realy feel like home.Great staff & very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here if you need the internet”
Reviews.Author: rogzog
Reviews.Content: We were on a business trip and needed access to the internet, which this hotel claims to provide (for an additional fee). Every time we wanted to connect to the internet or even send an email we had to go out of our room and walk along the external corridor and hold up our laptops to try to get a signal. What a frustrating waste of time. If we hadn't been staying with a group of colleagues we would have checked out - it was very disruptive. Also the fridge in our room leaked onto the floor all the time - we reported it but nothing was done, (they didn't even provide a floorcloth although we asked for one), so we just had to put up with wet feet any time we went near the fridge. Lastly, if two of you are staying in a room you will get a grand total of three coat hangers each. Remember this boasts that it is a long-stay hotel option. They obviously expect you to use their laundry a lot. We won't be agreeing to stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: syl512
Reviews.Content: I requested a non-smoking room which I got but when I walked into the room it smelled like cigarettes and cleaning chemicals. I actually found a cigarette butt in the room! The room was not clean. I found stains on the blankets. The kitchen was dirty. The shower head did not have a resting hook and water sprayed everywhere! I called the front desk to complain and asked for another room but all I got was a run around. The staff didn't seem to care that I was an unhappy customer. I was very disappointed with the entire hotel and I will never stay there again or in any of their chains!

Reviews.Title: “Very rude and dishonest”
Reviews.Author: RobyOrlando
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 beds room and they gave us a king bed room. We were very disappointed because we didn't want to sleep together and we specifically booked this hotel for getting a double room. they said there was also a couch bed in the room, but it had no sheets, no pillows, and it was very dusty and there were insects inside. The following day, a few hours after check out, we noticed we had forgotten my friend's coat. It was a very expensive Italian coat (about $1,000) so we went back to the hotel to pick it up and the reception lady told us she couldn't do anything because the manager had already gone home for the day and also housekeeping was, and she said she couldn't access housekeeping room, where the coat may be. She told us to call back the following day, so maybe they would had sent it to our home (5 hours driving distance) in case they found it. She refused to help us for more than half an hour, and she was lying because the manager was in the back, we saw him from the beginning. Since we told her we couldn't go back home without our coat, and she didn't care, we didn't have other choice than call 911. After 1 more hour, during which we kept asking kindly if she could please do something for finding our coat, because it was very expensive and very important to us, and she refused to help us (she also refused to call a manager or housekeeping at least to ask if they had found the coat), when the police arrived, after I went outside to speak with the police agents, the manager we had seen in the back office came to us with the coat in his hand and invented a story I didn't even understand! They wanted to steal our coat, and they only took it out from where they keep items when they saw the police. we had never had a more horrible experience in a hotel and we advise to distrust the homestead Studio Suites Miami Blue Lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic!! Rooms like a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: KamalTiwari
Reviews.Content: We went to Miami for 10 days and thought of booking a hotel with kitchen. That was the reason we got attracted towards Homestead Studios in Blue Lagoon. The location is good and the rates are cheap but the quality of this hotel is extremely bad. - There are flying insects all around the hotel which makes it impossible to go out of room. You can't even open your windows. The insects will enter the room if you take too much time while entering or exiting the room. Pathetic!! - Bad quality bed and linens. Not even sure if they were washed properly. - All the appliances were either rusted or badly damaged. When we entered the room all the appliances had a sticky veneer on top. We ended up spending a couple of hours just cleaning the appliances. - Rooms are smelly. The window is in front of the room and the kitchen and bathroom at the rear. There is no window at the rear. This makes the ventilation of the room very poor which causes smell. The rooms are very cheap but it is so due to a reason. The room is extremely bad and is not a value for money even at very low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: myshoesrgreen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 1 night. It was in very nice commercial area on the southern border of the Miami Airport. The neighborhood was very quiet, yet there were still many gas stations and restaurants within a mile or two. The front desk staff was very pleasant. I asked for extra pillows since only 2 came in the room, and they only had 1 extra, but they were nice so it wasn't so bad. The rooms were clean and no odor. Full refrigerator, coffee pot, dishes, pots and pans, 2 burner stovetop, kitchen sink and sample sized dishwashing liquid. We were only there for 1 night, but this would have been perfect for a longer stay. The room was quiet through the night, and the grounds felt secure with the gated access. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel & very central to go anywhere in Miami.I Love the location,because it's close by the airport .”
Reviews.Author: Natarox
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel,because his location is excellent.As I go to Miami for shopping.I leave in the morning ,return always after 11pm,so for me it's a very nice,save location close by everything.Nice staff.I realy like the kitchen,because every night I have to drink my cup of green tea,before my Beauty sleep.the special thing I also like is local calls are free of charge & no parking fees for your car.I realy feel like home.Great staff & very helpfull. In ONE word.The greatest thing I like from the hotel is,can go to Bally's gym & it's all included in the price,as if they don't have a gym.It's just 7minutes by car to this gym.So we can't complain of all the facilities U get from this hotel.This hotel is my second Home in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: tomkim5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week in early July 2010 for $55 / night base rate (before taxes and fees) and will highlight my review key points below. Overall, I would recommend this hotel which is more like a serviced apartment complex. It's solid value for your money and you'll be hard pressed to find anything decent at a cheaper price. Good: - Clean and functional rooms - Great location near Miami airport - Best price I could find in area - Friendly and helpful staff - Functional kitchen with stovetop, microwave, full fridge - Wifi internet for one-time $5 fee - Onsite coin laundry - Park right outside your door if you're on ground floor Bad: - Fitout of rooms very basic - Maid service only once per week (but can change towels daily at front desk) - Wifi Internet speed is only ok (not terrible but not good) - Location is decent but not much within short walking distance, need a car

Reviews.Title: “Good, roomy and clean hotel suitable for holidays and business persons”
Reviews.Author: Miguel_Peru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Miami International Airport and one of the cheapest in that area. I stayed here several times but was not happy with the cleanliness of the cutlery and the microwave oven. It was raining outside and I found a beetle in the room. Overall this place is recommended but check cutlery and other kitchen stuff if you plan to have snacks and drinks in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: JaimeAMC
Reviews.Content: Well, I had to do some errands in Miami, so I decided to take along my family for an extended week-end trip to Miami . Homestead Studio at Blue Lagoon Miami, was a a good-for-the price option. We booked in directly, no problems at all. It is well located, the Wi-Fi service is good, the room is clean. It is a fine deal for the money; when you check-in in a extended stay hotel you will not have every-day room service included or continental breakfast, but a spacious clean room, well groomed bathroom, good location, great staff service, are more than fair bargain though. I do recommend this hotel to all fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly recommend”
Reviews.Author: saetahn
Reviews.Content: My stay was good. The place es clean and people are friendly. Every thing was in good working condition. I definetly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SeashoreTrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week at the beginning of December. Room was very pleasant and spacious (we had a King suite). Rate was very reasonable. Yes, it's not within walking distance of much but we had a car so didn't care. Lots of shopping and restaurants within a 5 min. drive. Desk staff were always very helpful, pleasant and accommodating. Internet speed was OK - about DSL speeds. Seemed quite popular with "weekly" workers as a few pickups were always in the parking lot. But we could always park very near to our room. Can't say anything bad about the place. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: SandyCif
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I read the reviews I.thought that this place might be descent enough to sleep, also thought there were places within walking distance to eat. So, was I wrong, this place was disgusting. We checked in after 10pm at night and were there only until our flight early in the morning. We kept our luggage off the floor in fear of bugs. We asked the front desk about places to eat since we were starved and was told on the right was a bunch of places and on the left a cuban restaurant. We walked and walked in an unsightly and graffiti covered area. Nothing to be found, and finally went across the street to a hotel aways away and was told was at least an 8 minute drive. This while greeting hookers in the lobby. Feeling quite unsafe, walking back the other way towards the Cuban restaurant which was not there. We then walked back to the hotel where we purchased a bag of cheetos and a bottle of water. Locked ourselves in the room and put a chair in front of the door, slept a little(motorcycles racing down the street all night) and then got out of there. Dont go there, spend a few extra dollars and go to the Doubletree at the very least! All this plus had the priviledge of paying $15 each way for transportation. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: pdxrobyn
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel several months ahead due to its proximity to the airport. I checked back on their website and found the rate went down $15, so we called to get the better rate. Was told this was done "automatically". Of course, it wasn't. Not a huge deal, but irritating nonetheless. Front desk was very busy when we arrived - had to wait 10-15 minutes before being helped. We complained about the rate and the front desk clerk begrudgingly gave us a $4 discount. We were then put in a first floor room under the stairs by the garbage cans. Supposed to be non-smoking, but definitely smelled of smoke. Some lights didn't work in the room. We asked to be moved and they were very nice about it. Our second room smelled much better and felt cleaner. A/C rattled like crazy though, so it was unusable. I really felt this hotel was not worth the price I paid (about $115 before tax). I would have felt much better about it had it been less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Budget Travel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Pageofthebackstairs
Reviews.Content: The Homestead was really perfect for our travel needs. Since we live relatively near the beach in FL and December isn't really beach weather, we opted to stay somewhere less expensive than South Beach (and the general vicinity). Many of the places there charge for both parking (we drove) and resort fees. In fact, we booked the Homestead for the price of valet parking ($30/night) at some of the beach hotels. The place is very clean and seems to be located in a safe area. The property is gated, so only guests with keys may enter. There is a Publix (fairly upscale grocery store) right down the street, which was great for stocking the kitchenette. My only complains, if any, were the flat pillows and the fact that the kitchen includes a stove but no oven--we bought a frozen pizza and ended up taking it home b/c we couldn't cook it there. The front desk (Maria at check-in) was more than accommodating and friendly. When we requested more pillows and coffee, they sent someone with two fluffy pillows and coffee (for the maker) right to our door. Yes, you can hear the airplanes taking off and landing, but I wasn't bothered. The room fan/air conditioner drowns out most of the noise. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes from most of the attractions we were interested in--Bass Museum, Miami Museum of Art (downtown), the Wolfsonian (South Beach), the Rubell Family Collection (N. Miami). Costs $1.25 tolls daily--but beats paying for parking, etc., etc. in those areas. The absolute best and pleasantly surprising thing about this hotel was the free pass to Bally's Total Fitness for the duration of our stay. Indoor pool, hot tub, steam room, and sauna. Wonderful! A real bargain for $30 per night! If you're on a budget and don't need a beach within walking distance, a terrific place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Right Person”
Reviews.Author: NPFilho
Reviews.Content: Some preliminaries: The Homestead chain is geared for the long-staying guest, even if they also accept one-night stays. Also, let it be clear that it is not for the guest who wants to be pampered or to stay at a full service Hotel, but for the self-reliant person who wants functionality above all, even at cost of minimal guest service. You will have a basic room w/ queen bed, bathroom, armchair w/ ottoman, TV, Internet (one time configuration fee of $4.99), fair-sized wardrobe, worktable and kitchen (w/ refrigerator, microwave, toaster, stove, cookware and dinnerware) These preliminaries are necessary because a stay at a Homestead could be perceived as very good or disastrous based solely on the expectation of the guest, having nothing to do with the Hotel itself. In a tourism-bureau kind of classification, which is always based on the amenities the property offer, a Homestead Hotel would be a well kept 2-star or a median 3-star Hotel. In this review, as I think is more useful, instead of doing such an ammenities-list based classification, I will assume that the guest has chosen this kind of Hotel knowing its characteristics and will give a star-rating based not on such classification but instead on how well it works and is operated on its class. About the Homestead Blue Lagoon: This is a location geared for business, not for the usual tourist, as it is very far from Miami Beach or the Port of Miami. It would be a gross error for the casual tourist to book a room at this property: it is very near the airport, but it is also almost as far away as possible from the above tourist areas. Besides, there is no commerce in the immediate vicinity of the Hotel; a car is an absolute necessity here (as in most of Miami - exception made of South Beach) and, while it is usually hard to get lost in a grid-like city as Miami is, this property is a bit difficult to find to someone who doesn't know Miami well. The Blue Lagoon region is an agreeable one, near the Doral area, were you will find all the commerce and restaurants you need, with lots of greenery, quiet (while very near the airport, I don't remember ever hearing a noise) and the property has good security: it is an enclosed area w/ two automatic gates accessible only to the guests and has a guard on duty. Check-In and Check-Out were done very fast. At Check-In, the receptionist, Maria, was ease and pleasant, going the extra step as she called my room a few minutes later to ask if everything was OK! The other employees I have seen on the Hotel were also always with a smile on the face, which is nice to see and (probably) indicate they are satisfied working there. About the Room, Bathroom and Kitchen: First of all, everything was very clean; the mattress was new and firm; lightning was adequate, TV had lots of cable channels (with good image, even being an old-style CRT one, not a LCD); appliances were all clean and working, bathroom had lots of towels (fair ones, not the best, definitely not plush). The cooking utensils offered were chosen for their durability, not for appearance or lightness. Now we have the three main problems with this Hotel's concept, two of them inexcusable (as due to lack of attention to detail) and the third one a constant worry, but also more difficult to solve: 1) The Hotel does not offer detergent nor anything else to clear your dishes. This was not an accident, as other reviewers also complained of it. Having read them, I bringed my own, but I thing this is unexcusable, a direct contradition to this Hotel offer of convenience. 2) The fridge was placed at the right of the kitchen, next to the wall, but its door opened to the left, and the space between the fridge and the worktable was small, making it necessary but difficult to position yourself in front of the fridge, leaning on the wall, to be able to open the fridge's door. In such disposition, a fridge with a right-opening door would be much easier to use 3) The worktable: it is shared between the kitchen and the "office". So, much care must be taken not to spill food or liquids onto your computer or papers. Unfortunately, this is both the more annoying point and the more difficult to solve, as the table has a good size and there is no other vacant space in the room to put another good table for the "office". All in all, my stay was comfortable, the kitchen very useful, the internet (Wi-Fi) fast; to someone who choose this Hotel knowing its strong points and limitations, I will give four stars to my experience; it loses the fifth one due to the three problems above. And please remember that this star-rating is not saying that this Hotel is a four-star Hotel in the general sense, as explained in the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Just to sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: Hjaspe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, but extremely basic, aircraft noise from the airport, day and night, could be a problem. You do not have better facilities than the bedroom. Just to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: rjpresley
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay for a few hours before boarding a cruise without paying a lot. The bluelagoon was clean and in a good part of town. The staff was very friendly and held our room past late check-in due to a later flight. The night we got off the boat we had booked another hotel, because this one was full, and paid nearly $100 more and it wasn't any better quality. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted!!!”
Reviews.Author: imakeitispendit
Reviews.Content: It was the first time that I had booked a room for my husband and I to stay in. We were travelling by ourselves to Miami for the first time and I was very anxious to get everything right. I had heard about this hotel from a friend who warned me before hand that if I am looking for 5 star treatment this was not it! All I wanted was somewhere to sleep, eat and store my stuff while we shopped and this was just perfect for that. The rooms were large and clean. The website was up front about room and maid services being unavailable. It also indicated that toiletries could be replenished at the front desk along with towels. It also gave a brief overview of places of interest within the area. This was great! The kitchenette had a stove, fridge microwave and utensils. We were able to save on food by going to the grocery on our first day there. It has all these great malls within 10 minutes of driving and the airport is also very close. I would heartly recommend this to any traveller watching his dollars and cents and who has no need for creature comforts such as room service, mint on pillow etc. I will be going there again this year!

Reviews.Title: “?Security guard!?”
Reviews.Author: Forgottentraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homestead Blue Lagoon for one night before our cruise. We booked with the 1-800 number two rooms, one family for two nights and for us one night. The other family arriving one night before us. On they're arrival, the security guard didn't even have our name down on papers, computer, no confirmation # anywhere. They left the front desk with no room. So they knew this guy had no idea what he was doing so they pretended (long distance) to call us, and told the security guard that we were on the phone and that we couldn't understand why they're was no reservation even with a confirmation #, and that we were going to call the head office. So right away he gave them a room. We arrived at 10:30pm the next night, went to check in but the security guard at the desk, didn't have our papers with our name but the other family's name when we are the ones that booked it. WEIRD If staying at this hotel please make sure you arrive in the day time, to avoid the security guard at night. The room was o.k. but i think the sheets were dirty... still hair in the bed from previous occupants and tiny ants crawling in the bathroom, far from everything need a car to get anywhere. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and filthy”
Reviews.Author: mjmcd416
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We picked it because his choices were limited (we were traveling for his job and being reimbursed). We liked the idea of the mini-kitchen, and the location was good. We booked a non-smoking, king-sized bed room. "Non-smoking" is a lie at this place. Our room reeked of stale smoke as soon as we entered it, but we thought a previous visitor had smoked in it. Once the air conditioning kicked in, the smell became much stronger - and continued each time that happened. It seemed like all the rooms were on the same ventilation system, so smoke from another room was entering ours. It was horrible; the stench was so bad that our car smelled of cigarettes when we got home (thanks to us smelling the same), and we had to wash and Febreeze everything in our suitcase (regardless of if it had been worn) to get the smell out. The mini-kitchen was a disappointment - no sponges or dish towels, no soap provided, etc. It was also disgusting - smears and stains on the walls, cabinets, etc. This same problem was in the bathroom as well (along with the stained towels - at least we assumed they were stained and had at least been washed). There were also dead ants in the bed that we discovered the morning we were leaving (they also found their way into our bags, which we found when unpacking at home). We were pretty much afraid to touch most surfaces in the room, and we certainly didn't walk around without shoes on. We understood that housekeeping wasn't going to come in every day, but we also have standards regarding reasonable, basic cleanliness when we first check into a room. It seemed like our room hadn't been cleaned (beyond hopefully fresh sheets, towels, and perhaps a vacuuming) through multiple visitors. From our own research of this hotel, it was indicated that it had recently been upgraded, so we expected a much nicer, newer facility. It was one of the worst hotel experiences we've had. We considered demanding a new room while we were there, but we assumed that anything else we were given would be in similar condition. We definitely don't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: steveabassett
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 colleagues booked this hotel for 10 nights as part of a business trip. The rooms were $150 a night. Upon entering the room, we noticed the following: 1-No shampoo provided 2-Some rooms not clean 3-Maid service is weekly for stays over 5 days 4-No TV guide or any local information available in the room 5-No breakfast (snack food was available for purchase) 6-No pool 7-Rooms with kitchen areas had no dishwasher 8-Wireless Internet required manual intervention each night In short, I have stayed at Traveldges with better amenities. I would not recommend this place unless you have $150 a night to spend on what is essentailly a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: sandradeen
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel room for the night before a cruise leaving out of Miami. Since we were getting in so late, we wanted a hotel by the airport and that was inexpensive. I bid on priceline for $30 a night (ended up being $41 after tax, etc). Got a 2star room. I was a little concerned, with that hotel class level, but I was pleasantly surprised! Our room had a kitchen that came fully equipped, including a stove, refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave & dishes! (came in handy when we ordered pizza at midnight) :) The staff was friendly, although we did not have much interaction with them. I will comment that, although we did have a lovely room with a view of lake, it was in the rear of the complex and we didn't have a car, so we had to lug our bags quite a ways. Have your cab driver wait for you to check in if you don't have a car. It is a motel-type layout. All-in-all, a fabulous value!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Homestead -- Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homestead at Blue Lagoon for 4 nights, after having spent nearly two weeks in Nassau and Orlando. The Homestead met all our expectations: it is incredibly well located, the rooms are nice, new, comfortable and CLEAN, the personnel were all super attentive and helpful, we had free parking, we could cook and save tons of money in feeding a party of 8 (two families with two hungry kids each), and it is so close to the airport it was just perfect. The first score with the Homestead (after reading the reviews that we found here and on Expedia and deciding that this was the hotel for us) was the good rate that we got when we used their guaranteed best rate promotion. We searched on virtually every booking website and we found that the best rate published was on Cheap Tickets and it was cheaper than the rate published on the Homestead home page. So, we made the reservation on their corporate site and then completed the application, informing them about the lower rate we had found. Within 1 hour they wrote us back confirming what we had told them and giving us the Cheap Tickets rate, minus a 10% discount. We ended up paying a little over $51 per queen size room. One of these rooms wasn't available when we checked in so they upgraded us to a suite with a sleeper sofa. In addition we got a $10 discount per room for booking online and subscribing to their newsletter. Sweet. We booked three rooms: 2 queen sizes for the adult couples and one suite with a king size bed and a sleeper sofa for the 4 kids. All rooms had a kitchenette, with a two burner stove, a large fridge, microwave oven, coffee pot, toaster, pots and pans and cutlery. This was perfect to make breakfast for the entire tribe! The rooms are CLEAN, roomy, newly furnished, with large closets, comfortable bathrooms (including a tub), cable TV, a dresser, a night stand, free internet port, free local phone calls and air conditioning that actually worked. Being close to the airport did not bother us; we could hardly hear any planes taking off or landing. The hotel is located in a very nice area. My husband and I have spent a lot of time in Miami and to be honest, Blue Lagoon was a new area and quite a revelation for us. It is very safe, quiet and beautifully landscaped. We were very close to the Dolphin Expressway (836) that connects you to virtually any place in the Miami metro area that you may want. We were a large party with a total of 13 suitcases and 6 carry ons. We were riding on a van and it is imaginable that we all could not fit on the van WITH our luggage, LOL. So, staying near the airport was one of the considerations that made us choose this hotel. Making two trips to the airport to carry passengers, then luggage and then return the car at Dollar in less than 40 minutes total, was only possible due to the Homestead Blue Lagoon's location. Yes -- they don't clean your room or make your bed every day. You need to pick up your own stuff and try to keep some order and tidiness in your room. But you can carry your dirty or wet towels to the front desk and exchange them for fresh ones at any time, as well as your sheets. If you run out of toilet paper or soap, they are happy to replenish them at any time, same as if you need an extra pillow or anything at all... you just need to take a little stroll to the front desk and help yourself. Our cable went off after a thunder storm (apparently some lightning struck on the hotel) the night before. We called the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy to fix it within 10 minutes. They have two washer/dryer rooms, that work with quarters. Washer and dryers are brand new and they are located very conveniently on each wing of the hotel. The access to them is with your door card key as well as the access to the premises of the hotel, with a device that opens up a bar gate to the parking areas. We felt very safe at all times. The nice and friendly front desk personnel are there from 8:30 am until 10:30 pm. After that they only have security guards, so you need to make sure that you have everything you need from them before closing time. They have a little store with all basic necessities, including TV dinners, milk, candy, snacks, toiletries, etc. As a fun detail, they have a "Special Guest" announcement at the front desk for the passengers that are checking in every day. My brother in law was the special guest the night that we checked in and got a complimentary product from their little store as a welcome gift. Yeah -- a $2.00 little thingy, but quite a courtesy that we really did not expect and gave us a smile and a Kodak moment. My husband and I go to Miami several times a year. We will definitely be staying at the Homestead Blue Lagoon every time. We found that it was an excellent value for our money. Of course we have stayed in much fancier hotels, but in Miami who stays in a hotel more than to sleep, shower and change clothes? You just want to be out and about either at the beach or the malls. If these are your plans while in Miami and you are looking forward to spending most of your budget in the stores, the Homestead Blue Lagoon is an unbeatable choice. It did the job for us with flying colors!

Reviews.Title: “Had To Wash Our Own Towels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was okay, even though they never came to clean up the room and we were there for four nights. The sheets on the bed are VERY cheap, so cheap you can see right through them. We also had to empty our own trash. We were informed that they ran out of towels, so we had to wash our own towels in the laundry room. It costs us $4, that's $4 we could have spent on something else for our vacation. I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and basically this is a friendly place. People working here are very nice and try to help. We were given a huge room with 2 beds without extra charge. Unfortunately the room was robbed by the previous occupant and we had almost nothing left but the hotel staff were nice to get us every thing we asked for: blankets, saucer pans, knives and forks, clock, remote control, etc. But I think the management should be more strict in checking the room amanities to make sure every thing is there.

Reviews.Title: “Homestead - Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Robin922
Reviews.Content: Great place for the long stay person or family! Clean, very frendly, large rooms, and a family can save $$ with the mini kitchen. Only down side, is very close to airport... while not too loud, you can hear the take offs and landings.

HotelInfo.Name: Homestead Miami Blue Lagoon
HotelInfo.Address: 6605 NW 7th Street, Miami, FL 33126
